html:
The Canon USA Store currently has some nice discounts on refurbished Canon EOS R10 camera bodies and kits. You can get the body only for $699 (Reg $879) and $799 (Reg $999) when paired with the RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM.

This is a great price for the EOS R10, which will probably hit $999 once the current Canon USA rebates expire next week.

The Canon EOS R10 is our favourite APS-C camera from Canon from a value perspective, it’s a great camera. We haven’t used the EOS R50 V yet, so we’re not including that camera in our opinion

Purchase Options

  • Canon EOS R10 Body $699 (Reg $879)
  • Canon EOS R10 w/RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM $799 (Reg $999)
  • Canon EOS R10 w/RF-S 18-150mm f/3.5-6.3 IS STM $1019 (Reg $1279)

Overview

  • 24.2MP APS-C CMOS Sensor
  • Dual Pixel CMOS AF II
  • 4K30 Video, 4K60 with Crop; HDR-PQ
  • 23 fps E. Shutter, 15 fps Mech. Shutter
  • 2.36m-Dot OLED EVF
  • 1.04m-Dot Vari-Angle Touchscreen LCD
  • Multi-Function Shoe, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth

Emphasizing portability without sacrificing on capability, the Canon EOS R10 is a sleek mirrorless camera with a hybrid ethos.

Adept in both photo and video worlds, the R10 brings an APS-C sensor to the R system, along with high-speed shooting, intelligent AF, and impressive 4K video recording to complement a multimedia workflow.

Purchase Options

  • Canon EOS R10 Body $699 (Reg $879)
  • Canon EOS R10 w/RF-S 18-45mm f/4.5-6.3 IS STM $799 (Reg $999)
  • Canon EOS R10 w/RF-S 18-150mm f/3.5-6.3 IS STM $1019 (Reg $1279)

When you purchase through links on our site, we may earn an affiliate commission. Here's how it works.

Craig is the founder and editorial director for Canon Rumors. He has been writing about all things Canon for more than 17 years. When he's not writing, you can find him shooting professional basketball and travelling the world looking for the next wildlife adventure. The Canon EOS R1 is his camera of choice.
